alert.note: Alert for Mitchell (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 12 at 10:26PM CDT until April 13 at 1:30AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: The National Weather Service in La Crosse has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Mitchell County in north central Iowa... * Until 130 AM CDT. * At 1026 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 2.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Osage, St. Ansgar, Lyle, Stacyville, Mitchell, McIntire, Carpenter, Little Cedar, Toeterville, Osage Spring Park, Meyer, Pioneer State Park, Mona, Otranto Park, and Rock Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
